DOC.brief_summary: The Canadian hypertension education program recommends increase physical activity , adoption Dietary Approaches Stop Hypertension ( DASH ) diet , reduction sodium alcohol intake treatment prevention hypertension . Objective : To describe patient participate interdisciplinary lifestyle intervention reduce blood pressure family medicine primary care set . Design : Descriptive study . Participants : The study aim recruit 60 sedentary hypertensive patient participate 6-month randomized-controlled trial . To eligible , patient must ≥18 year age , sedentary ( 7-day measure steps/day self-report ) , hypertensive ( base 24-h ambulatory blood pressure measurement [ ABPM ] ) , non-smoker , non-diabetic without dyslipidemia . Intervention : Patients recruit health care professional family medicine unit thereafter randomize one four intervention group : 1 ) standard medical care ( control ) , 2 ) improve diet ( DASH diet ) , 3 ) physical activity , 4 ) improve diet physical activity . Patients evaluate ( pre , mid post intervention ) , monitor , educate interdisciplinary health care team include physician , kinesiologist , nutritionist nurse , depend intervention group . T-tests descriptive statistic use analyse data . This study document efficacy primary care lifestyle intervention program cardiometabolic hypertension risk factor .
